Class javachart.chart.Chart 
All Packages  Class Hierarchy  This Package  Previous  Next  Index

Class javachart.chart.Chart 

java.lang.Object
   |
   +----javachart.chart.Chart
public class Chart
extends Object
implements ChartInterface
An abstract class that implements several methods common to all charts. Subclasses of Chart inherit a variety of addDataset methods and implementations of all the standard access methods defined in ChartInterface. Most final classes based on the Chart class are fairly simple, requiring initialization of Axes and chart components.
See Also:
ChartInterface, AreaChart, BarChart, BarLineChart, DAreaChart, DateLineChart, FinComboChart, HiLoBarChart, HiLoCloseChart, HorizBarChart, HorizHiLoBarChart, IndBarChart, IndColumnChart, LabelLineChart, LineChart, PieChart, RegressChart, SpeedoChart, StackBarChart, StackColumnChart, StickChart

getXOffset 
  public int getXOffset()
3-D effects are added by drawing effect panels offset in X and Y directions. This method returns the current X offset value in pixels

  public void setXOffset(int i)
sets the X offset for 3-D effects in pixels
Parameters:
i - new offset value

getImage 
  public Image getImage()
Returns this chart's Image, if it has been installed and produced. This image is used internally by JavaChart's RotateString class to rotate text strings with raster operations. This must be a valid chart Image to rotate strings properly. This image may also be used after drawing for other operations, such as exporting image files or for clipboard operations.
setImage 
  public void setImage(Image i)
installs an Image for use in JavaChart's RotateString class. Normally, this is the Image associated with the Graphics class used for drawing charts.
Parameters:
i - an Image class used for drawing charts;
getDisplayList 
  public DisplayList getDisplayList()
returns JavaChart's central DisplayList.
See Also:
DisplayList, Globals
setDisplayList 
  public void setDisplayList(DisplayList d)
installs a new DisplayList for use in retrieving a list of chart objects at a specified location.
getUseDisplayList 
  public boolean getUseDisplayList()
inquires whether this chart accumulates drawing information into a central DisplayList.
setUseDisplayList 
  public void setUseDisplayList(boolean yesNo)
Determines whether this chart will use a DisplayList to acquire geometric information about chart objects or not. By default, JavaChart's DisplayList is not active.
Parameters:
yesNo - true if you wish to use a DisplayList
See Also:
DisplayList, Globals
